messages.message:
How useful will it be to have a single switch in preferences to enable `View as external user`?
This could disable all internal only/preview features and show everything as an external user. Could be used for demos and testing.

For UAT, I usually log in using xindi’s external accounts (search for “xindi external” in 1Password) and do stuff using that account

For demos, have you seen internal users accidentally use internal-only features? Usually the feature will be GA soon, so at that point, it’ll be available externally, right?

Cc @Xindi Xu
Yea, i'd recommend using an external account for this.

Do you think external accounts solve the problem? I think it's doable to have a single switch to disable all preview features, but I want to gather some more feedback before implementing this. cc @hannah

Oh yes, I intended this thread to gather feedback, not a feature request.
I've seen the need to switch to an external account and seen some threads in aihub-support which were resolved by switching off some feature flag. Just wanted to know if anyone has opinions on this.
One issue with having the `View as external user` is if people keep it on we may lose some internal testing data for IB_OPT_OUT features

Let's collect more feedback first! A lot of our internal users end up actually (intentionally) use internal features (that are close to GA) in demos to preview what is to come, so I don't think this will help too much

I could see it being helpful for troubleshooting weird behavior as toggling it could allow for a quick test to see if the weird behavior stopped or is still persisting on the same files+projects you're working on without needing to change accounts, copy things over, or recreate anything elsewhere.

To continue gathering data on preview features, what do you think about giving this toggle a timer? Perhaps setting it only lasts for 10-24 hours, then it reverts back to your standard settings (ideally with some sort of alert so the user knows that it changed).
I think we have higher priority things to work on right now. Let's hold on this for now.
